intro: Psorospermum bracteolatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, typical of the genus Psorospermum. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
